free.util
Class MemoryFile

java.lang.Object
  free.util.MemoryFile

public class MemoryFile
extends java.lang.Object

An implementation of a virtual file, whose contents are kept in memory.

Constructor Summary
MemoryFile()
          Creates a new, empty, MemoryFile.
MemoryFile(byte[] data)
          Creates a new MemoryFile initialized with the data from the specified byte array.
MemoryFile(byte[] data, int bufSize)
          Creates a new MemoryFile initialized with the data from the specified byte array and the initial buffer size.
MemoryFile(int bufSize)
          Creates a new empty MemoryFile with the specified initial buffer size.
 
Method Summary
 void clear()
          Clears this file, resetting its size to 0.
 java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
          Returns an InputStream that will read from this MemoryFile.
 java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
          Returns an OutputStream that will write into this MemoryFile.
 int getSize()
          Returns the size of the file.
 void writeTo(java.io.OutputStream out)
          Writes the contents of this MemoryFile into the specified OutputStream.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

MemoryFile

public MemoryFile()
Creates a new, empty, MemoryFile.

MemoryFile

public MemoryFile(int bufSize)
Creates a new empty MemoryFile with the specified initial buffer size.

MemoryFile

public MemoryFile(byte[] data)
Creates a new MemoryFile initialized with the data from the specified byte array. The specified byte array is copied.

MemoryFile

public MemoryFile(byte[] data,
                  int bufSize)
Creates a new MemoryFile initialized with the data from the specified byte array and the initial buffer size. Note that if the specified initial buffer size is smaller than the length of the byte array, it will only be user when/if the contents of the file are cleared.

Method Detail

getSize

public int getSize()
Returns the size of the file.

getOutputStream

public java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
                                     throws java.io.IOException
Returns an OutputStream that will write into this MemoryFile. Only a single open OutputStream is allowed per MemoryFile. Note that invoking this method clears the current contents of the file.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an open OutputStream writing into this MemoryFile already exists.

getInputStream

public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
Returns an InputStream that will read from this MemoryFile. Note that the data read from the returned InputStream will be the data in the file when this method is invoked. If more data is written into the file or the contents of the file are cleared, the returned InputStream will not be affected.

clear

public void clear()
           throws java.io.IOException
Clears this file, resetting its size to 0.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the file is currently open for writing.

writeTo

public void writeTo(java.io.OutputStream out)
             throws java.io.IOException
Writes the contents of this MemoryFile into the specified OutputStream.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
